This app is designed to be used as a steering wheel in some popular truck simulators.

Developer: Alex Churkin

Contact:
churkindev@gmail.com

The application uses icons from here:
http://icons8.com
First, you need to download Truck Remote Control Server and run it on your PC. You can do it by this link: https://github.com/alexChurkin/TruckRemoteControlServer .

As you can see, you can specify connection port and movement sensitivity as you want. Then you need to start the game and enable mouse control. You can also slightly increase \"Steering non-linearity\" as in this screenshot:
Make sure all keys in the control settings are set as standard and "Automatic blinker turn off" option is disabled. Enter the game and proceed to the next step.
Center wheel by your mouse if it wasn\'t centered before:

Turn off truck turn signals, disable parking break and all headlights (do not leave the high beam enabled when low beam is disabled). Ensure that your phone/tablet is connected to the same network as the PC. Connect your Truck Remote Control app to server app on your PC. This can be done automatically or manually. You can configure a standard ip/server in the settings.

P.S. Truck Remote Control Server is still in development. Therefore, we apologize for the displacement of the steering wheel (it can be fixed manually by mouse) and some another wrong work. Pleasant use!
